TextBlock._LCLZText: Opens the materials database for you to select an appropriate polymer.
The polymer used to mold the part is a key component of the injection molding process. Select a material that matches the actual material closely, to ensure an accurate simulation.
Displays the properties of the chosen study material.

From the list on the left of the dialog, select different property categories, such as Recommended Processing conditions, to see the associated values on the right. Use this data to select a material, and to set appropriate processing conditions.
Defines the locations where the polymer is injected into the part.
Select the optimal injection locations to fill the extreme parts of the mold at the same time and under the same pressure. Avoid faces with a high aesthetic requirement.
Edit existing injection locations where plastic material will be injected into the mold.
Solves the simulation on the cloud, based on the specified settings.
Run the Precheck before launching the analysis. Close the Solve dialog to set up more studies. Open it again to view the job status and manage your cloud credits.
View the results to see if your part is likely to fill, warp, or have visual defects.
Result are viewable as soon as the analysis is complete. View Guided Results for assistance to intepret the Fill, Warp and Visual Defects results. View Results to see all results.
Defines faces with a high aesthetic requirement, that must be free from blemishes.

Select faces that should be visually appealing in your model. These faces display in yellow on the canvas. Make sure you don't place the injection locations on aesthetic faces, because it causes blemishes.
Select the body that will be used for injection molding
Sets an Injection Time and other process settings, such as a Melt temperature and Mold Surface Temperature.

Use the default settings which come from the material database or are calculated by the solver, or modify them if you prefer. If you modify them, stay within the values recommended by the material manufacturer.
Indicates the flatness of selected faces, relative to a specified flatness plane.
Select the Warpage tab of the Guided Results to activate this command. Change the flatness indicator threshold to match your model's flatness tolerance.
Emulates the effect of applying surface texture to the part.
Select the Visual defects tab of the Guided Results to activate this command. Adjust the reflectivity and surface texture to see how the surface defects might be made less apparent.
Queries the data at specified surface locations and records the information with labels.
Probe as many points as necessary. Hover to preview the data, click the surface to attach the labels, and select OK to save the probe locations.
Shows all probe labels showing query results.
Hide all probe labels showing query results.
Remove all probe labels showing query results.
